arm_group.description: Consecutive acute drug self poisoned patients admitted in the ED.

brief_summary.textblock:
There is no consensus on monitoring criteria in acute self poisoning. Clinical scores, vital
      signs or lactatemia have failed to prove good predictive value.

      The main acute self poisoning complication is decreased consciousness level with consequent
      increased risk of hypoxemia and aspiration pneumonitis.

      Several clinical studies have recently shown that EtCO2 monitoring can be valuable in
      procedural sedation in the emergency department. It is able to predict hypoxemia before any
      SaO2 decrease and any complications related to these procedures.

      We therefore hypothesized that EtCO2 could help in acute self poisoning patients' monitoring
      in the ED.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  >18y/o

          -  acute self poisoning patients

          -  patients requiring monitoring according to physician's opinion

          -  patients not requiring invasive ventilation at ED admission

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnant woman

          -  patients deprived of liberty

study_pop.textblock: All patients over 18y/o admitted in the ED for acute self poisoning.

clinical_study.keyword: Intoxication, overdose, poisoning, EtCO2, emergency medicine
clinical_study.official_title: Continuous EtCO2 Monitoring in Acute Self Poisoned Patients Admitted in an Emergency Department

primary_outcome.description:
Poisoning complications are defined as:
Hypoxia (Spo2<93%) and/or Respiratory rate <10/min or >25/min and/or ICU admission and/or Oro tracheal intubation
primary_outcome.measure: ROC curve of maximal EtCO2 to predict poisoning complication
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the first 2 hours of ED admission

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
